content.description: the crux is the high step onto the ramp into a series of crimps to the top
content.location: This problem when facing the wall is to the right of the big crack it starts at the low point on the small ramp follow slopey ramp until ramp ends and go back to the left and up.

content.description: the crux is near the beginning of the problem.
content.location: this is the stand alone boulder by the river. SDS on the right side of the boulder follow very slopey edge to the left and top out.

content.description: if there is a crux it would be at the start.
content.location: to the right of Vamanavataram the crack that goes from left to right follow it up.

content.description: the crux again is about half way through the climb, follow the ramp up to the point go straight up from there the crack is off.
content.protection: pads + pads there is a boulder laying in the LZ carefule not to twist an ankle.
content.location: This is in between crack the whip and Vamanavataram big wall with tiny crimpy holds all the way. there is a possible variation just to the right with a few side pulls.

content.description: the crux is the half way point through the climb very slopey ramp.
content.location: start in the same place that you would start hinky only use the ramp nothing above until you reach the big crack and then up.

content.description: the crux is near the beginning of the problem a sit start on small crimpy sidepull on the left near the bottom of the problem and open hand pinch with the right hand on the big flake follow the flake up to sloping sidepull topout
content.location: this is about 12 feet to the left of the crack problem.

content.description: the crux is about half way through the climb. good landing zone. This is a very good warm up.
content.location: this route is to the left of the big crack follow the ramp up to small jug and then straight up the face.

content.description: the crux of the crack is near the top, keep to the right near the top of the crack the jug on the left is off
content.location: The only obvious crack on the boulder

content.description: Start sitting on block at base. Look for good foot at base. Left Crack and all crack features are off. Left start hold is sharp chip. Stand up and move right onto face. Power thru crimps and rails to top.
content.location: Sit on block riverside of BFB. Put one pad down low and one on the block. Sit start of course.

content.description: small wall with a handful of problems with a possibility for variations. There are still a few open projects.
